solution_line_template: Each employee gets paid {shirts_per_employee}*{pay_per_shirt}=$<<{shirts_per_employee}*{pay_per_shirt}={shirt_pay}>>{shirt_pay} for the shirts they make
They also get paid {hourly_wage}*{hours_per_shift}=$<<{hourly_wage}*{hours_per_shift}={hourly_pay}>>{hourly_pay} for hours worked
So they get a total of {shirt_pay}+{hourly_pay}=$<<{shirt_pay}+{hourly_pay}={total_pay_per_employee}>>{total_pay_per_employee} per day
So they make {total_shirts}*{price_per_shirt}=$<<{total_shirts}*{price_per_shirt}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue} from selling shirts
So they made a profit of {total_revenue}-{total_employee_cost}-{nonemployee_expenses}=$<<{total_revenue}-{total_employee_cost}-{nonemployee_expenses}={profit}>>{profit}
